meanings.definition: A person who travels on foot.
meanings.sent1: The wayfarers walked along the dusty road under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: Many wayfarers enjoy hiking in the mountains during the summer.
meanings.sent3: The wayfarers decided to have a race to see who could walk the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In the land of imagination, the wayfarers were brave adventurers on a quest.
meanings.sent5: The wayfarers' journey through the forest was filled with excitement and discovery.

meanings.definition: A pair of sunglasses with large lenses.
meanings.sent1: She put on her stylish wayfarers before heading out into the bright sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The fashion store had a display of trendy wayfarers in various colors.
meanings.sent3: The wayfarers were so big that they covered half of his face, making him look funny.
meanings.sent4: Her future was as bright as the lenses of her favorite wayfarers.
meanings.sent5: The wayfarers shielded her eyes from the glaring sun, allowing her to see clearly.
